2410.08814.title: A Social Context-aware Graph-based Multimodal Attentive Learning Framework for Disaster Content Classification during Emergencies
2410.08814.paper_summary:
In times of crisis, the prompt and precise classification of disaster-related
information shared on social media platforms is crucial for effective disaster
response and public safety. During such critical events, individuals use social
media to communicate, sharing multimodal textual and visual content. However,
due to the significant influx of unfiltered and diverse data, humanitarian
organizations face challenges in leveraging this information efficiently.
Existing methods for classifying disaster-related content often fail to model
users' credibility, emotional context, and social interaction information,
which are essential for accurate classification. To address this gap, we
propose CrisisSpot, a method that utilizes a Graph-based Neural Network to
capture complex relationships between textual and visual modalities, as well as
Social Context Features to incorporate user-centric and content-centric
information. We also introduce Inverted Dual Embedded Attention (IDEA), which
captures both harmonious and contrasting patterns within the data to enhance
multimodal interactions and provide richer insights. Additionally, we present
TSEqD (Turkey-Syria Earthquake Dataset), a large annotated dataset for a single
disaster event, containing 10,352 samples. Through extensive experiments,
CrisisSpot demonstrated significant improvements, achieving an average F1-score
gain of 9.45% and 5.01% compared to state-of-the-art methods on the publicly
available CrisisMMD dataset and the TSEqD dataset, respectively.
2410.08814.paper_summary_zh: 在危機時期，社群媒體平台上分享的災難相關資訊的快速且精準分類對有效的災難應變和公共安全至關重要。在這些關鍵事件期間，個人使用社群媒體進行溝通，分享多模態的文字和視覺內容。然而，由於大量未過濾且多樣化的資料湧入，人道主義組織在有效利用這些資訊方面面臨挑戰。現有的災難相關內容分類方法通常無法建模使用者的可信度、情緒背景和社交互動資訊，而這些資訊對於準確分類至關重要。為了解決這個差距，我們提出 CrisisSpot，這是一種利用基於圖形的神經網路來捕捉文字和視覺模式之間複雜關係的方法，以及使用社交背景特徵來納入以使用者為中心和以內容為中心的資訊。我們還引入了反向雙嵌入注意力 (IDEA)，它捕捉資料中的和諧和對比模式，以增強多模態互動並提供更豐富的見解。此外，我們提出了 TSEqD（土耳其-敘利亞地震資料集），這是一個針對單一災難事件的大型註解資料集，包含 10,352 個樣本。透過廣泛的實驗，CrisisSpot 展示了顯著的改進，與現有技術在公開的 CrisisMMD 資料集和 TSEqD 資料集上相比，分別達到了平均 F1 分數提升 9.45% 和 5.01%。
